fields.name: Waste - Significant waste - Significant waste

Q1.ui:title: Describe the inputs, activities, and outputs that lead or could lead to these impacts
Q1.ui:tooltipshadding: Please specify the inputs, activities, and outputs that lead or could lead to actual and potential waste related impacts.Include: The types of inputs and outputs can include raw materials, process and manufacturing materials, leaks and losses, waste, by-products, products, or packaging.

Q2.ui:title: Describe whether these impacts relate to waste generated in the organization's own activities or to waste generated upstream or downstream in its value chain.
Q2.ui:tooltipshadding: Please provide the description of the impacts relate to waste generated in the organization's own activities or to waste generated upstream or downstream in its value chain. Impacts: effect the organization has or could have on the economy,environment, and people, including on their human rights, which in turn can indicate its contribution (negative or positive) to sustainable development.

fields.name: Waste - Management of significant waste - Management of significant waste

Q1.ui:title: Describe actions taken to prevent waste generated from organization's own activities, upstream activities and downstream activities in its value chain
Q1.ui:hadding: Actions taken to prevent waste generation and to manage significant impacts from waste generated
Q1.ui:tooltipstitle: Include: Actions mentioned should include actions including circularity measures.
Q1.ui:tooltipshadding: Include: Actions mentioned should include actions including circularity measures.

Q2.ui:title: If the waste generated by the organization in its own activities is managed by a third party, describe of the processes used to determine whether the third party manages the waste in line with contractual or legislative obligations.
Q2.ui:tooltipstitle: Third-party: Third party includes a public or private waste management organization, or any other entity or group of individuals formally or informally involved in handling the reporting organization's waste.Include: Agreements in a contract for the third party to follow when managing its waste, or rely on existing legislative obligations, such as local environmental laws and regulations
Q2.ui:tooltipshadding: This section documents the data corresponding to the waste generated by the organization in its own activities is managed by a third party.

Q3.ui:title: Describe the processes used to collect and monitor waste-related data
Q3.ui:tooltipstitle: Please specify the processes used to collect and monitor waste-related data. Include: Processes can include online data entry, maintaining a centralized database, real-time weighbridge measurement, and annual external data validation.
Q3.ui:tooltipshadding: This section documents the data corresponding to the processes used to collect and monitor waste-related data.

Site.title: Site
Site.tooltiptext: On-site: 'Onsite' means within the physical boundary  or administrative control of the reporting organization Off-site: 'Offsite' means outside the physical boundary \ or administrative control of the reporting organization

Unit.title: Unit

WasteType.title: Waste Type
WasteType.tooltiptext: Please specify the type of waste. e.g. Paper waste, E-waste, chemical waste etc.

Wastecategory.title: Waste category
Wastecategory.tooltiptext: Select the waste category from the given dropdown.

RecoveryOperations.title: Recovery Operations
RecoveryOperations.tooltiptext: Recovery: Operation wherein products, components of products,or materials that have become waste are prepared to fulfill a purpose in place of new products, components, or materials that would otherwise have been used for that purpose.Recovery Methods: Preparation for reuse: Checking, cleaning, or repairing operations, by which products or components of products that have become waste are prepared to be put to use for the same purpose for which they were conceived.Recycling: Reprocessing of products or components of products that have become waste, to make new materials

fields.name: Waste - Waste directed from disposal - Contextual info

Unit.title: Unit

WasteType.tooltiptext: Please specify the type of waste. e.g. Paper waste, E-waste, chemical waste etc.

Wastecategory.title: Waste category
Wastecategory.tooltiptext: Select the waste category from the given dropdown.

Methodofdisposal.title: Method of disposal
Methodofdisposal.tooltiptext: Disposal: Any operation which is not recovery, even where the operation has as a secondary consequence the recovery of energy Landfilling: Final depositing of solid waste at, below, or above ground level at engineered disposal sites Incineration: Controlled burning of waste at high temperatures

Source.title: Source
Source.tooltiptext: Where does the company get its materials from? Internally sourced materials: Materials that the company makes itself.Externally sourced materials: Materials that the company buys from other companies.

Datasource.title: Data source
Datasource.tooltiptext: What is the source of the data for the total weight or volume of materials used? Estimation: process of making an approximate calculation of something.Direct measurement: process of measuring something directly. For example, a company might directly measure the total weight or volume of materials used by weighing or measuring each batch of materials used.

fields.name: Water and effluents - Interaction with water - Interaction with water

Q1.ui:title: Describe how the organization interacts with water.
Q1.ui:hadding: Interactions with Water as shared resource
Q1.ui:tooltipstitle: In the description, include how, and where water is withdrawn, consumed, and discharged, as well as water-related impacts the organization has caused or contributed to, or those that are directly related to its operations, products, and services. An overview of water use across the organization�s value chain.

Q2.ui:title: Describe the approach used to identify water-related impacts
Q2.ui:tooltipstitle: Include scope of assessments, their timeframe, and any tools or methodologies used.

Q3.ui:title: Describe how water-related impacts are addressed
Q3.ui:tooltipstitle: Include how the organization works with stakeholders to steward water as a shared resource, and how it engages with suppliers or customers with significant water-related impacts

Q4.ui:title: Describe the process for setting any water-related goals and targets that are part of the Organization's approach to managing water-related impacts.
Q4.ui:tooltipstitle: Include water-related goals and targets that are part of the organization�s approach to managing water and effluents, and how they relate to public policy and the local context of each area with water stress

fields.name: Water and effluents - Interaction with water - Management of water discharge

Q1.ui:title: Describe any minimum standards set for the quality of effluent discharge.
Q1.ui:tooltipstitle: Include a description of standards used to set the quality of effluent discharge.

Q2.ui:title: Describe the process of determining discharge standards for facilities with no local discharge requirements
Q2.ui:tooltipstitle: ndicate how the company determine discharge standards for facilities without local discharge requirements.(Please specify the identification method use to determine standards (if any)

Q3.ui:title: Describe internally developed water quality standards or guidelines used (if any)
Q3.ui:tooltipstitle: Include how the organization works with stakeholders to steward water as a shared resource, and how it engages with suppliers or customers with significant water-related impactsDescribe how the internally developed water quality standards or guidelines were determined.

Q4.ui:title: Describe the sector-specific standards or guidelines used (if any)
Q4.ui:tooltipstitle: Provide a description of how the sector-specific standards were considered

fields.name: Water and effluents - Interaction with water - Profile of receiving waterbody
Water and effluents - Water withdrawal/discharge from all areas - Water withdrawal/discharge from all areas

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.tooltiptext: Select the correct unit corresponding to the quantity of water withdrawal/discharge

Source.title: Source
Source.tooltiptext: Indicate where the company withdraws water from or Where the company discharges water into.Include (where applicable)the breakdown od water withdrawal and discharge data by: Surface Water; Ground water; Seawater; Produced water Third-party water

enum: Freshwater (Below or equal to 1000 mg/L Total Dissolved Solids)
other water (>1000 mg/L Total Dissolved Solids)
Watertype.title: Water type
Watertype.tooltiptext: Provide a breakdown of total water withdrawal/discharge from each of the sources by following categories of water: 1) Freshwater: water with concentration of total dissolved solids equal to or below 1,000 mg/L. 2) Other water: Other water constitutes any water that has a concentration of total dissolved solids higher than 1,000 mg/L.

discharge.title: Total water discharge
discharge.tooltiptext: Indicate the total amount of water discharged

withdrawal.title: Total water withdrawal
withdrawal.tooltiptext: Indicate the total amount of water withdrawn

Businessoperations.title: Business operations
Businessoperations.tooltiptext: Indicate the business operations for which water is withdrawn or discharged Include: Upstream operations - Upstream operations include identifying, extracting, or producing materials. For example, raw material extraction & transportation. Downstream operations - It refer to the final processes in the production and sale of goods, where finished products are created and sold to consumers. For example, logistic and packaging, distribution of product etc. Onsite water usage - For example, in service based companies water is used onsite for cleaning and maintenance, general sanitation etc.

fields.name: Water and effluents - Water withdrawal/discharge from all areas - Third party

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.tooltiptext: Select the correct unit corresponding to the quantity of water discharge.

Volume.title: Volume of water
Volume.tooltiptext: Indicate the amount of water sent for use to other organisation

Discharge.title: Do you discharge third-party water and send it to use for other organizations?
Discharge.tooltiptext: Third party water is defined as: municipal water suppliers and municipal wastewater treatment plants, public or private utilities, and other organizations involved in the provision, transport, treatment, disposal, or use of water and effluent if you discharge third-party water and it is sent to use for other organizations, then please provide the volume of the total water sent for use to other organizations

fields.name: Water and effluents - Water withdrawal/discharge from areas water stress - Water withdrawal/discharge from areas water stress

Unit.title: Total water storage at the beginning of the reporting period
Unit.tooltiptext: Select the correct unit corresponding to the quantity of water withdrawal/discharge.

Source.title: Source
Source.tooltiptext: Indicate where the company withdraws water from or Where the company discharges water into.Include (where applicable)the breakdown of water withdrawal and discharge data by: Surface Water; Ground water; Seawater; Produced water Third-party water

Pincode.title: Pin code
Pincode.tooltiptext: Mention the pin code of the area or location (of Water stress area) where the organization withdraws water from or discharges it into.

enum: reshwater (Below or equal to 1000 mg/L Total Dissolved Solids)
other water (>1000 mg/L Total Dissolved Solids)
Watertype.title: Water type
Watertype.tooltiptext: According to disclosure 303-3(c) of GRI company shall provide a breakdown of total water withdrawal from each of the sources by following categories of water: 1) Freshwater: water with concentration of total dissolved solids equal to or below 1,000 mg/L. 2) Other water: Other water constitutes any water that has a concentration of total dissolved solids higher than 1,000 mg/L.

waterstress.title: Name of water stress area
waterstress.tooltiptext: Which area or location does the organization withdraw water from or discharge it into?

Waterdischarge.title: Water discharge
Waterdischarge.tooltiptext: Indicate the total amount of water discharged by the company into the water stress area?

Waterwithdrawal.title: Water withdrawal
Waterwithdrawal.tooltiptext: Indicate the total amount of water withdrawn by the organization from the water stress area

Businessoperations.title: Business operations
Businessoperations.tooltiptext: Upstream operations: Upstream operations include identifying, extracting, or producing materials. For example, raw material extraction & transportation. Downstream operations: It refer to the final processes in the production and sale of goods, where finished products are created and sold to consumers. For example, logistic and packaging, distribution of product etc. Onsite water usage: For example, in service based companies water is used onsite for cleaning and maintenance, general sanitation etc.

fields.name: Water and effluents - Water withdrawal/discharge from areas water stress - Water withdrawal from areas water stress

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.tooltiptext: Select the correct unit corresponding to the quantity of water withdrawal/discharge.

Source.title: Source
Source.tooltiptext: Indicate where does the third-party withdraw water from?

Quantity.title: Quantity
Quantity.tooltiptext: Please specify the amount of water withdrawal from third-parties

Discharge.title: Do you withdraw water from third-parties?
Discharge.tooltiptext: Do you withdraw water from third parties? if yes then please provide a breakdown of the total third party-water withdrawn by the withdrawal sources. Third-party water: municipal water suppliers and municipal wastewater treatment plants, public or private utilities, and other organizations involved in the provision, transport, treatment, disposal, or use of water and effluent

fields.name: Water and effluents - Substances of concern - Substances of concern

Approach.title: Approach for setting discharge limits for priority substances of concern
Approach.tooltiptext: Provide a description of the approach used for setting discharge limits for priority substances of concern.

Priority.title: Method used to define priority
Priority.tooltiptext: Indicate how does the company define the priority substances of concern

Discharge.title: Do you discharge any substances of concern
Discharge.tooltiptext: Do you withdraw water from third parties? if yes then please provide a breakdown of the total third party-water withdrawn by the withdrawal sources. Third-party water: municipal water suppliers and municipal wastewater treatment plants, public or private utilities, and other organizations involved in the provision, transport, treatment, disposal, or use of water and effluent

Noncompliance.title: No of noncompliance incident
Noncompliance.tooltiptext: Indicate the number of times the organization has engaged in unauthorized discharges (non-compliance incidents) exceeding compliance limits? (if any)

Substanceconcern.title: Substance of concern
Substanceconcern.tooltiptext: Mention the substances of concern for which discharges are treated.In the context of GRI Standard, substances of concern are those that cause irreversible damage to the waterbody,ecosystem, or human health. For example: chemicals, pollutants, heavy metals, contaminants or any toxic substances.

fields.name: Water and effluents - Substances of concern - SMA

StandardsUsed.title: Standards Used
StandardsUsed.tooltiptext: The answer could include any contextual information necessary to understand how the data have been compiled,such as any standards used. methodologies, and assumptions used.

Methodologiesused.title: Methodologies used
Methodologiesused.tooltiptext: The answer could include the description of methodologies used to compile data.

Assumptionsconsidered.title: Assumptions considered
Assumptionsconsidered.tooltiptext: The answer could include the description of assumptions considered to compile data

fields.name: Water and effluents - Change in water storage - Change in water storage

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.tooltiptext: Select the correct unit corresponding to the change in water storage.

Reporting1.title: Total water storage at the end of the reporting period
Reporting1.tooltiptext: What was the water storage capacity of the company at the end of the reporting period?

Reporting2.title: Total water storage at the beginning of the reporting period
Reporting2.tooltiptext: What was the water storage capacity of the company at the beginning of the reporting period?

Reporting3.title: Change in water storage
Reporting3.tooltiptext: Change in water storage = Total water storage at the end of the reporting period - Total water storage at the beginning of the reporting period

fields.name: Water and effluents - Change in water storage - SMA

DataSource.title: Data Source
DataSource.tooltiptext: Please specify whether the information is calculated, estimated, modeled, or sourced from direct measurements.

StandardsUsed.title: Standards Used
StandardsUsed.tooltiptext: The answer could include any contextual information necessary to understand how the data have been compiled, such as any standards used. methodologies,and assumptions used.

Methodologiesused.title: Methodologies used
Methodologiesused.tooltiptext: The answer could include the description of methodologies used to compile data.

Approachconsidered.title: Approach considered
Approachconsidered.tooltiptext: Describe the approach taken to compile the information e.g. any sector-specific factor used.

Assumptionsconsidered.title: Assumptions considered
Assumptionsconsidered.tooltiptext: The answer could include the description of assumptions  considered to compile data
